contentfulPost.title: Too Much Negativity?
contentfulPost.metaTitle: How to Deal with Media Stress

metaDescription.metaDescription: How often do you look at your mobile device? Do you feel stress from persistent media exposure? Here are a few helpful tips to ease the tension of everyday news.

Instead of constantly checking in on current events, set a time during the day where you can stay updated. For some people, stepping away from the news completely does not seem feasible so instead set a time limit. Maybe schedule it during breakfast or lunch. Although experts advise not to dive into the news after dinner or before bed.

Taking a break from the news might be a good step. If you chose to schedule your news time, make sure you also set aside time for self-care. Many professionals suggest reading, exercise, listening to music, calling a loved one, and practicing meditation. Make time to destress with things that bring you joy.
